Description: Silver spoon; large egg-shaped bowl, slightly concave, with plain flat rim, the pointed end being away from the handle; handle ends in a 'keel' under the bowl, and then turns over in a volute-form, to which is attached a double volute or calyx, the rest of the stem being elaborately moulded.
Bibliographic references: Silver / Catalogue of the Silver Plate (Greek, Etruscan And Roman) in the British Museum (94)
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
